html:
357 U.S. 578

78 S.Ct. 1394

2 L.Ed.2d 1548

Leonard K. HANSFORD, Jr., petitioner,
v.
UNITED STATES of America.

No. 826, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

June 30, 1958

Leonard K. Hansford, Jr., pro se.

Solicitor General Rankin, for the United States.

On petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit is vacated and the case is remanded to that court for consideration in light of Ellis v. United States, 356 U.S. 674, 78 S.Ct. 974, decided May 26, 1958. It is ordered that the judgment in this case issue forthwith.
